Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good morning everybody. Who would like an authentic New York bagel? Hmmm? Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Thank you. [reaches for bagel]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I got a pumpernickel just for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow. H & H. You went all the way to New York City to get us bagels?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, why? Is there a place closer that sells them?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This is really nice Dwight, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, don't mention it. You owe me one. You all owe me one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good morning Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Morning Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I had a fish stick sandwich. Actually I had two fish stick sandwiches. My girlfriend didn't want hers. Because I guess I'm the only aphrodisiac she needs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fish sticks are not an aphrodisiac.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're thinking of deer penis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It worked.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Regardless. That was over two hours ago and it is now a scientific fact that you are hungry. [holds up tray] Bagel?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't mind if I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: K. I brought cheese too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm taking one for my lady friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Brain food. Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. [walks out of Michael's office] You owe me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can't a guy just buy some bagels for his friends so they'll owe him a favor which he can use to get someone fired who stole a co-manager position from him anymore? Geez. When did everyone get so cynical?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, would you care for a bagel?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right. You're a woman and you need to refuse food the first time. I'll try again. Please Pam, reconsider and have a bagel.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have an early lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael's been trying to get Jim and me to hang out ever since he started dating my mom. I don't know. I really hoped this thing would just die out, but today he's planning a birthday lunch for my mom and we have to go. No way out. No way out.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: These are amazing. You took all these?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I've always found beauty in uncommon places. Homeless people. Graffiti. Photography lets me capture all that. Have you ever been photographed before?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh just by like friends.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well here's what I've been doing around here. It's for a series on exposure in the workplace.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [walks into the office] Whoohoo! Pammy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey! [gets up to greet Helene] Hey. Happy birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Thank you. [they hug]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [comes over to hug them both] My girls. There they are. [Pam walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Birthday lunch. Birthday lunch- there is no better medicine than birthday lunch. It'll cure all of your "Gee I don't know if Michael should be dating my mother" and fixes all occurrences of "I don't really see them together". So, open wide Pam and take a big old spoonful of birthday lunch medicine. Take with food.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pam, aren't you going to introduce us to Michael's girlfriend?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think you guys all remember my mom from the wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think everyone has meet Helene. Shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Wait a minute. [looks at the bag in Michael's hand] Is that another birthday present for me cause you already gave me a necklace.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God I love it. [looks at camera and shakes head]

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Tell her how you gave it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that wouldn't be-

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: He put it around my neck while I was still asleep this morning. What a nice way to wake up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. The rest of the story has been censored due to- inappropriosity.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Because of sex?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please, Kevin. You're fired. [Kevin looks at Jim; Jim shakes his head] Sorry, sorry. Work with a bunch of idiots. Shall we go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, let's go. [looks at Erin and nods]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, wait. Um- Swartz Lumber is on the phone for you Pam and they say it's urgent.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, you guys. Just one second. [picks up phone] Oh my gosh! Are you serious? Shipping emergency. I don't think I can go to lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh man, that's crazy. Right as we were on our way out too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. Isn't that always how it goes?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Rarely. If ever. Let me give it a whirl. I'll talk to them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want to handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel like its-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's my pleasure. [takes phone from Pam] Hello? Well that's great. [hangs up phone] Turns out the paper was there all along.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [sighs] Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Something's up. That paper was never supposed to arrive.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: So, Pammy- are you still liking sales?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah- it's exciting.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Well, you know- Michael and I were- talking, and maybe if you put a little more face to face time with your clients you could improve your sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam's sales are fine actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just want you to succeed Pammy. You know what, we shouldn't even be talking about business today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today is about family.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why did I get in the car? I could of struggled. I have a whistle in my purse I didn't even blow it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, Dwight. I have a little surprise for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me guess- you ate the bagel I gave you and loved it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! [they laugh] And I wanted to return the favor. I was polishing my loafers and I happened to look over and noticed that your brief case was a little worse for the wear, so a little elbow grease and she's polished right up, back up to her former glory.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Feel it against your cheek.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will. [Andy rubs the briefcase against Dwight's face]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You give me a gift- Bam! Thank you note. You invite me somewhere- Pow! RSVP. You do me a favor- Wham! Favor returned. Do not test my politeness.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me get that door for you- [runs to open door]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There you go!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you very much. Now I've got it for you. [holds open door]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh... goodness... thanks. You know, here's a healthy fitness tip. If you clench your buttocks together while walking you can really take the pressure off your knees.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is that right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Observe. [walks towards desk]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Huh. [laughs; follows Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That really works.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, feel free to use that. Anytime. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey- oh, hold on a second. Do not walk around with your jacket cattywampus.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [straightens Andy's tie] And that needs to be straight as an arrow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa- thank you very much. [takes off Dwight's glasses and blows on them] Oh boy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you very much for that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [puts Dwight's glasses back on Dwight's face] You are very welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [pulls out Andy's chair] Have a seat. Allow me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [pulls out Dwight's chair] Have a seat yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? I am going to preemptively change the batteries in your wireless mouse.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not necessary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no! [takes mouse and runs away]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You didn't have to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy is complicating things. But I'm not worried. This will only up my game.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. Scott. Table for four.

Quote.Speaker: Hostess
Quote.Text: Welcome Scott family. It'll be just a moment.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I use to love coming here. The chicken parm is good. Big part of my childhood. Oh, maybe Michael will start dating that too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What table should we take? So many to choose from.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [sees table decorated with a banner and balloons] Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? All I see are boring old tables with no birthday decorations. Oh, wait a second! You mean this one? Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, you did all this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not about taking credit. Let's just say we all did it.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Well, thank you. All of you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it was actually me alone, so- wow look at this place. Really makes me want to go to Italy some day.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh you'll love it. You can have my guide books. I think I'm done with those really long plane rides.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Thank you. Thanks for lending me the books.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, mom... which birthday are we celebrating this year?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [laughs] Sticking with 49.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 49 again? That's nine years in a row. This is now our longest family tradition.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Well, as long as you're running numbers Pam, then help me out with this one. Let's see your six months pregnant, but you've only been married for 30 days, so what does that add up to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, burn. Burn on you... and a little bit on me, too. [they laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're 54 years old.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: No. I'm 58.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're 58 years old?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The only time you should care about a woman's age is if she is too young for you and I am not robbing the cradle. If anything I am robbing the grave.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mom, have you decided what you want to be called?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh, well I like Nana, but I also like the classic Grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please be Grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Definitely Grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want you to be Grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael what do you think? Grandma?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [nods uncomfortably] That-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yay, Grandma!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, would you guys ever do a triathlon, do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Helene?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh, oh no. I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am. I'm definitely going to do it. I've already got the run and the bike thing down. Just need to learn how to swim. Come on, you in?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh no, I think a triathlon is pretty much something I can rule out. It just- doesn't interest me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So it's a matter of interest. Good, okay. It's not anything you would have ever done.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Hmm... I might have done it when I was younger, but now there's just other things I'd rather be doing, instead of running and jumping and swimming-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well there's no jumping in a triathlon.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're thinking of the broad jump. Would you try- bungee jumping?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: No, no... [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Snowboarding?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: You want to go snowboarding?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I might.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Michael, what are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Nothing. Just life- and doing things- before you die. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I really want to go snowboarding? No. But I would like to if I wanted to.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing fanfare] Aye-yi-yi! [lifts covers off trays of food]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's going on in here?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy bought lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh... no... really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yep, yep. Took a page right out of the old Schrute book of niceness.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is no book. There's only a survival guide.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You bought breakfast for everyone, so I got lunch for everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, well, allow me. You know what- gosh these tacos are awfully complicated to make. I will make everyone's tacos! Gra-ga-ga-ga-ga!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So we should get the check?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What about your gift Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no. No. It's stupid. You'd hate it. I hate it.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: I'm sure I won't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you will.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He locked himself in his office all morning working on it.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Gimme. Look at this wrapping paper. It's got the word love on it in every language.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aww-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I literally- I put no thought into the wrapping at all. Might as well of been toilet paper.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [opens present, reads inscription] A scrapbook of our first memories by Michael Gary Scott. For my girlfriend Helene on your birthday. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's just an arbitrary title.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Ok, there's a penny. What's that from?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Penny for your thoughts.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: It was from the wishing well at the mall. You threw it in. I went back later, waded in and I found it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not amazing... at all. It's sort of weird that I went and did that. And now your wish won't come true, so that blows.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [looking through the book] A poem!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh that I plagiarized I think.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [reading] I can not go to school today said little Peggy Ann McKay...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispers to Pam] Shel Silverstein.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Um- I have the measles and the mumps, a gash, a rash and purple bumps. And my teachers really mean- Happy Birthday , I love you Helene.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's really nice Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michel
Quote.Text: I think it sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: I think it's wonderful, absolutely wonderful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's because you and I have very different tastes and you like lame things. It's a generational- sort of gap between us.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [hugging book] God... it's a scrapbook.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Home run Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You set the bar so high.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a bunt.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa Dwight. I'm going to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey- relax I got it covered.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I insist.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no, no, I insist. [pushes Andy out of the room and locks the door]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwight this is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't worry about it. You can just owe me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. Where'd you go?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, just went to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And then you stopped at the bar on the way back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got thirsty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, weirdo. Come on. It's time for cake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Honestly, for a long time I thought I was going to grow old with Holly. And then I met Helene. And she is great and she already knows and has done everything that I have ever wanted to do and can tell me about it. But, I think I want to do those things myself.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cakes really good.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Oh, I know. I love how they use butter cream frosting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Finish your cake, Helene.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Hmmm?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to enjoy that cake because I have something terrible I need to tell you. I want you to enjoy your cake before I tell you this terrible, terrible thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Helene I think you're a wonderful person and I- God- I've enjoyed dating you and being your boyfriend so much. But I have to consider Pam's feelings as a friend and a co-worker I can not in good conscience continue to date you, when I know what this is doing to her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael. Michael ,it's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know that it took me a little while to come around and its still a little weird to get used to, but you obviously make my mom very happy. And that makes me happy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. That just- you've really grown.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [covering eyes] Thank you Pam. And I hope you are as gracious during this next part. Helene, once again you are a wonderful person and you have lived a great life and I envy it. And I want it someday, but just in the future. You need somebody who- who understands your references. Who is Kafkaesque? I've never- I don't know him. There's another woman. And her name is Italy... and skydiving... and bungee jumping.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I want kids. And you... unfortunately, have already completed that part of your journey down there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not my decision. It's mother nature. And mother has very strict rules about fer- [waitress comes over to pour water; long pause] -- tility.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: I, um- I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: I'm 58. What am I supposed to do now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, hobbies-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [reaching for something on the top shelf] Ahh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stupid things wedged up there. No one in this office will help me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright, move it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What if Dwight dies and I still owe him something? That is a recipe for a ghost.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, you're going to owe me big time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's like a little envelope- there you go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it. [looks at envelope] To Dwight. Wha- [opens envelope] Starbucks gift card.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Surprise! [laughs] It's from everybody. $15 value.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dammit. I am no closer to taking Jim down. What a waste of a day. I could of grown poisoned mushrooms that would have been this high by now. [bends over and hold hand about 1/2 an inch from the floor] They're mushrooms. They don't get that high.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pamela Beesly Halpert-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: May I have a word with you in my office please?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am working.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, this is a work related matter.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Join me please, won't you? [Pam gets up and follows Michael into his office] I am going to give you a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because of all the good work you've done.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have the lowest sales record of anyone here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's- no, no- it's not about numbers, Pam. It's about attitude.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have the worst attitude of any person here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want the raise or what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'll take it. [turns to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam, Pam- with this raise there are strings attached. [Pam sighs] And the string is attached from my heart to your mean attitude.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're bribing me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! No- no I am not. Unless you want me to. DO you want me to? Cause I will. I will bribe you. No. Your face is saying don't- unless I haven't offered you enough... your face isn't changing. What is it? Talk to me face. Tell me what Pam's brain is thinking. Come on! What do you want? What do you want? Do you want a million dollars? Do you want to hit me? Want me to get down on one knee and beg you or-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want to hit you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want to hit you. I'll do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [nervous laughter] Oh- okay , what? I don't- Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ye- No. Alright. I'll take off my jacket and tense my stomach and you can just-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. I don't think I can hit you in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, um... we'll do it after work. In the parking lot. In front of everyone. I'm going to hit you as hard as I can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: See you then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Quick question.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Are you scared?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never. About what? A little- what are you talking-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We heard about the punch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What punch?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Pam. She's going to punch the crap out of your face after work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm pretty sure we said slap.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, it's a punch and Pam has that crazy pregnancy strength now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm getting concerned that you don't seem to understand what's going to happen. Do you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I- mmm- I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: alright. See you there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you and Pam ever get frisky?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean- do you ever wrestle with each other?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She strong?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She wants it bad Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you stop this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I don't support her choice to hit you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't either.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But at the same time she looks crazy and I do understand her reasoning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm. I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just need some time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You gotta do something-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just need some time. Just give me some time to make a decision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How much time do you think you'll need?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No more than a week. Maybe two weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, man!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Pam, can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I heard about the hit. Just- make sure it's off company property, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, I think we should probably be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay. And- the-the power- comes from the back foot. So its- its all one motion through the- body. So you stay a little low and there's a twist. You keep your shoulder down and you kind of throw out the arm. [demonstrates punch] Pow!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [stands up; gets into stance] Okay wait- it's- you're saying it comes from the foot.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. [punches Toby's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey everybody, he's not in the men's room although the seat was warm so we may have just missed him.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My money's on Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not a fight. What other outcome could there be?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael could win.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How? He can't hit back.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why can't you just agree with me sometimes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Am I scared of getting hit in the face? No. Everyday weirdo's pay dominatrix's hundreds of dollars for that very privilege. I'm scared I'm gonna love it. [claps hands] Let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's okay guys... I can handle this. Everybody can go home.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We're here for the show, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're just a bunch of voyeurs. Are you eating popcorn?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It has almost no calories.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [goes to punch Michael; he flinches] You have to keep your hands down, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. [sighs] Okay. Alright. [Pam goes to punch him again] Oh- God!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, you have to put your hands down.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Put your hands in your pockets.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! [braces himself] Pam, Pam- I'm really sorry. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you sorry for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So many things. I don't know. It's hard to choose.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How about for dating my mom?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe that-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And dumping her on her birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay- just- don't ever date a member of my family again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. I promise. [Pam starts to walk away] For the record your mom came on to me. [Pam turns around and slaps him; he gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Holy crap.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Feel better?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. You were right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walks with Michael back into the office; Michael is clutching is face and limping] Wait, why are you limping?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get some raw meat on that face. I got a chicken in the freezer upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As I watched Pam's big, strong hand coming towards my face I saw my entire life flash before my eyes. And guess what? I have four kids. And I have a hover-car and a hover-house. And my wife is a runner and it shows. And Pam and Jim are my best friends and our kids play together. And I am happy and I am rich and I never die. It doesn't sound like much, but its enough for me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh... [Dwight is holding a frozen chicken to his face]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, good. Keep it on there for another five minutes. Just let the swelling go down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh thank you. Thanks. I owe you one Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fire Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm cashing in the favor. Fire him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you talking about-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do it. Promote me. Tri-managers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Forget that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I have an office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what you can keep your stupid favor. It's worthless. And this is my dinner on your face. I'm keeping it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pats face] Oh that feels better.
